item.title: Rachel add a quote by Deb Caletti
item.description: "Rejection, though--it could make the loss of someone you weren't even that crazy about feel gut wrenching and world ending." -- Deb Caletti

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Because one believes in oneself, one doesn't try to convince others. Because one is content with oneself, one doesn't need others' approval. Because one accepts oneself, the whole world accepts him or her." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything: the ability to discriminate, to love and to remain indifferent. To lack it is to be locked within oneself, paradoxically incapable of either love or indifference. If we do not respect ourselves, we are on the one hand forced to despise those who have so few resources as to consort with us, so little perception as to remain blind to our fatal weaknesses. On the other, we are pecularily in thrall to everyone we see, curiously determined to live out - since our self-image is untenable - their false notions of us... " -- Joan Didion

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you're in pitch blackness, all you can do is sit tight until your eyes get used to the dark" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Life is not like water. Things in life don't necessarily flow over the shortest possible route." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. " -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Here's all you have to know about men and women: women are crazy, men are stupid. And the main reason women are crazy is that men are stupid." -- George Carlin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "All truth passes through three stages: First, it is ridiculed; Second, it is violently opposed; Third, it is accepted as self-evident." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Sophocles
item.description: "The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities." -- Sophocles

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself in your way of thinking." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinion of himself than on the opinion of others." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not "This is misfortune," but "To bear this worthily is good fortune." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Begin each day by telling yourself: Today I shall be meeting with interference, ingratitude, insolence, disloyalty, ill-will, and selfishness – all of them due to the offenders’ ignorance of what is good or evil." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Nothing happens to anybody which he is not fitted by nature to bear." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "When another blames you or hates you, or people voice similar criticisms, go to their souls, penetrate inside and see what sort of people they are. You will realize that there is no need to be racked with anxiety that they should hold any particular opinion about you." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The memory of everything is very soon overwhelmed in time." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess, and then thankfully remember how you would crave for them if they were not yours." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "If any man despises me, that is his problem. My only concern is not doing or saying anything deserving of contempt." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor
